intro: Hesperis turkmendaghensis, commonly known as the Turkmenian honesty, is a rare flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions of Turkmenistan and neighboring countries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
